meanings.definition: A member of the old Russian nobility
meanings.sent1: The boyards were respected for their noble heritage.
meanings.sent2: In the past, boyards played important roles in Russian society.
meanings.sent3: The boyards decided to host a grand feast to celebrate their ancestry.
meanings.sent4: The boyards stood tall like ancient pillars of nobility.
meanings.sent5: The boyards' lineage traced back to the earliest days of Russia.

meanings.definition: A title of honor or rank in Russia
meanings.sent1: Receiving the title of boyards was a great honor.
meanings.sent2: The boyards were given their titles for their service to the country.
meanings.sent3: The boyards jokingly referred to each other by their titles at the banquet.
meanings.sent4: The title of boyards shone brightly among the other honors.
meanings.sent5: The boyards wore their titles with pride and dignity.

meanings.sent1: The boyards owned vast estates across the Russian countryside.
meanings.sent2: Many peasants worked on the lands owned by the boyards.
meanings.sent3: The boyards decided to invest in a new type of crop for their estates.
meanings.sent4: The boyards' wealth spread like golden fields under the sun.
meanings.sent5: The boyards' manors were the envy of all other landowners.
